qas.question: In Iran's western Zagros Basin, what are the average daily temperatures during winter?
In Iran's western Zagros Basin, temperatures do not exceed what level during the summer?
The eastern and central basins of Iran experience how much annual precipitation?

answers.text: less than 200 mm (7.9 in) of rain

qas.question: What is the coastal plains of Iran's annual precipitation ranges?

context: To the west, settlements in the Zagros basin experience lower temperatures, severe winters with <a0_0>below zero<a0_0/> average daily temperatures and heavy snowfall. The eastern and central basins are arid, with <a2_0>less than 200 mm (7.9 in) of rain<a2_0/>, and have occasional deserts. Average summer temperatures rarely exceed <a1_0>38 °C (100.4 °F)<a1_0/>. The coastal plains of the Persian Gulf and Gulf of Oman in southern Iran have mild winters, and very humid and hot summers. The annual precipitation ranges from <a3_0>135 to 355 mm (5.3 to 14.0 in)<a3_0/>.
